Detailed Description

This class represents pair of alternative segments (PAS).

For details see [1].

Note
The definition of what PAS is unused is different from the paper, see isUnused().

Member Function Documentation

bool PAS::addOrigin ( DAGraphTapas *  dag)

Adds bush dag to the set of relevant origins of this PAS. If this bush is already in the set, it won't be added.

Returns
true if origin wad added, false otherwise.
Note
The pointer to entire bush is stored instead of origin index in order to facilitate access to some information required by PAS.
FPType PAS::calcSegCost ( int  index)
private

Calculates cost of a segment given its index.

FPType PAS::calculateFlowShift ( )
private

Calculates minimum possible shifts for each origin and minimum possible total shift. It also calls getFlowShift() and ensures that it does not exceed minimum possible total shift.

bool PAS::checkIfCostEffective ( FPType  cost) const
inlineprivate

Checks if current PAS is cost effective.

Parameters
costreduced cost.
Returns
true if PAS is cost effective, false otherwise.
bool PAS::checkIfEffective ( FPType  cost,
FPType  v,
int  index,
DAGraphTapas *  dag 
)

Checks if current PAS has flow and is cost effective (for details see [1]).

Parameters
costreduced cost.
va specific parameter of TAPAS that is used in order to consider a PAS as flow effective.
indexindex of the expensive link of bush under investigation.
dagpointer to a bush under investigation.
Returns
true if PAS is effective, false otherwise.

int  index,

) const
private

Checks if current PAS is flow effective.

Parameters
va specific parameter of TAPAS.
indexindex of the expensive link of bush under investigation.
dagpointer to a bush under investigation.

true if PAS is flow effective, false otherwise.
FPType PAS::getCostDiff ( )
Returns
cost difference between two segments.
FPType PAS::getFlowShift ( )
protectedvirtual

Calculates flow shift that must be performed from expensive segment to cheap one.

Reimplemented in PASWithStep.

StarLink * PAS::getLastCheapLink ( )
Returns
last link in the cheap segment. NULL is returned if the segment is empty. This method is used in PASManager for checking if PAS exists already.
StarLink * PAS::getLastExpLink ( )
Returns
last link in the expensive segment. NULL is returned if the segment is empty. This method is used in PASManager for checking if PAS exists already.
int PAS::getNbLinks ( ) const
Returns
total number of links belonging to both segments.
int PAS::getNbOrigins ( ) const
Returns
total number of origin associated with this PAS.
bool PAS::isUnused ( )
Returns
true if PAS is unused, false otherwise. PAS is unused if the flow was not moved or if the entire origin flow from expensive segment was moved.
Note
This definition of unused PAS is different from what is written in the paper (according to numerical experiments it works faster - it is better to delete PAS more often).
bool PAS::moveFlow ( )

Performs flow move within PAS, updates corresponding link flows and travel times.

Returns
true if flow was actually moved, false otherwise.
void PAS::print ( ) const

For debugging. Prints segments on screen.

void PAS::pushBackToCheap ( StarLink *  link)

This method is used for creation of segments of current PAS. Adds link to the back of cheap cost segment.

void PAS::pushBackToExp ( StarLink *  link)

This method is used for creation of segments of current PAS. Adds link to the back of expensive cost segment.

void PAS::pushFrontToCheap ( StarLink *  link)

This method is used for creation of segments of current PAS. Adds link to the front of cheap cost segment.

void PAS::pushFrontToExp ( StarLink *  link)

This method is used for creation of segments of current PAS. Adds link to the front of expensive cost segment.

FPType PAS::recalcPASCosts ( )

Recalculates costs of cheap and expensive segments and updates corresponding pointer to cheap segment (after several iterations cheap segment might become an expensive one).

Returns
cost difference of segments

Member Data Documentation

SetType PAS::relevantOrigins_
private

set is used in order to have log n complexity on insertion. Also uniqueness is ensured.

FPType PAS::totalShift_
protected

minimum possible total shift of flow
